TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TogglePattern extends System.Windows.Automation.BasePattern

Docs.summary: Represents a control that can cycle through a set of states and maintain a state once set.
Gets the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .
Docs.value: A structure containing the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for the control pattern.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern.Current%2A> to get the current value of a property.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern.TogglePatternInformation>.

Docs.exception: The requested property is not in the cache.

Docs.summary: Gets the current [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .
Docs.value: A structure containing the current [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for the control pattern.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode> reference in order to get current values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern.TogglePatternInformation>.

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-cs[UIATogglePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIATogglePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Toggle() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cycles through the toggle states of an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A control will cycle through its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState> in this order: <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState>, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState> and, if supported, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePattern>control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> and is subsequently used to toggle the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-cs[UIATogglePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIATogglePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.vb#101)] [!code-cs[UIATogglePattern_snip#102](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.cs#102)] [!code-vb[UIATogglePattern_snip#102](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.vb#102)]

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TogglePatternIdentifiers>.
An <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> must cycle through its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState> in this order: <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState>, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState> and, if supported, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState>.
## Examples In the following example, a root element is passed to a function that returns a collection of automation elements that are descendants of the root and satisfy a set of property conditions.
[!code-cs[UIATogglePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.cs#100)] [!code-vb[UIATogglePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATogglePattern_snip/UIATogglePattern_snippets.vb#100)]
